column5: Pics with video.....taking my Go Pro for underwater shots

Whitefish Bay Camp on LOTW in mid June, Lac Suel in August.Am really looking forward to both, between the weather and the WI deer season around here, its been a long fall, I'm looking forward to open water!

After about 30 years the yearly Red Lake trip is done, died a couple years back when people either died off or went on to other things.I am hoping to get one more trip up there if I can find someone to go with.I am also looking for a LOW and Vermilion this year.Plus all the Great lakes fishing I can get in.. Oh..I just remembered I'm invited to a trip to Ballard's Black Island and I think that's in Canada too. Al
First week of Aug, 4 guys

12 days on the Albany river with 7 lakes wilderness camps June 11 - June 22. Very peaceful spot at Teabeau lake, a couple of Walleye fillets, a cold Molson, a million stars at night, and a trillion mosquitoes! Makes me a happy man. Good luck to all my fellow fishermen & enjoy your time in the wilderness.

Mid July. Had a great time last year and looking forward to 2014. 2013 was supposed to be our last blast on a fly in due to the cost. Many of the old timers skipped 2013 because of the cost. When we reported back how much fun we had, the old timers made us book 2014. No problem for me, a week in the bush is as good as it gets. Even my electronic addict 10 and 11 year old boys can't wait to go back. They learned Euchre, Michigan Rummy, Solitaire and Poker along with some days just driving the boat for no other reason but to explore. Happy New Year
lotw june 28th till july 8th.. laughing water trailer park sioux narrows...
August 8-16. Minaki area. Cant wait.
pm me if interested in coming to rainy lake
Where do you go on Rainy? Bill
Pickle lake w white river air last week of August
Both the trip and your holiday gathering sounds like just plain "fishing fun" with a big group of folks. Best of luck on shore lunch mania !!!!!
Going to give Nagagami/Walton's Kay Vee Lodge a try this year, taking my teenage son, middle of July. I'm excited.
Washi Lake with Leuenberger's June 1-7, 2014 and then Windsor Lake with Eddie North in July 2015.
Fly from Denver to Minneapolis, drive to Red Lake Ontario and float plane to Caribou National Park. May 24 to May 31!! Bring the warm clothes!!

mike we are going to black bear lodge on red lake last week of may mid sept debating between woman river camp outpost on woman river went two years in a row narrow portage for walleyes is worth the trip could have caught walleyes all day last year 18-20" range (great) or stokes camp on rainy river canada side seems very remote or williams lake resort on sw lac seul talked to owners seems good mid sept any COMMENTS on any CAMP appreciated jim wolf chicago boys blessed christmas amd joyous new year to all fishermen
My oldest boy and I are going to Talston River on Great Slave Lake....can't wait. A few more trips to Cabela's should do the trick........those Pike don't stand a chance.
Enjoy Windsor, fished it in 2006 lots of water, walleyes are an excellent size. Some huge pike are waiting for you
Awesome New Hips!!! Can't wait for a report on this trip!
Grassy Narrows (English River) for the last week of July, then Rainy Lake for the first week in October.
Witch bay camps, LOTW. July
June 13th 22 of us to Lake Minnitaki . This will be our 26th year in a row at PAC !
I'm planning 3 trips next year 1 in spring to NW Ontario, summer up above Sudbury and back to Nipigon in fall and beyond. Paul
Mailed off the deposit for Black Bear Lodge on Red Lake for the week of Aug 2nd. 4-6 guys going as of now! Room for more! Dave
Lac Seul Aug 17th. Houseboat up to Taylor Island again for another great week of fishing and fun.
6 Good Ol' Boys going to Blackstone Lake in June with Hidden Bay Lodge for for some stupid easy fishing. 5 Days in Paradise! Spring can come soon enough!
Green's Popular Grove Birch Lake June, Big North Lodge Roger Lake Aug, Swwl Lac Seul Sept.

All time record, 16 guys headed to Big Canon to start fishing on June 7th. The all group is back together after biting the bullet in some tough economic times. Plus we have a few new recruits. The variety of water and he variety of species has something for everyone. Shore lunch could be a zoo. Today is the annual holiday get together to start the planning and relive the follies of past trips.
Going back to BOULAY. Going to be there with my fishing bud. Can guarantee noone has ever been there--takes 3 portages to get in there.
Late June to Mahkwa Lodge on Lac Seul Mid August to Amik Lodge on Rainy LakeEach for a week
eddie north's windsor lake 1st week of june o'sullivan outfitters abamasagi lake naknia 3rd of july can't wait

Every local and surrounding lake I possibly can,crap weather or not.I need to try new lakes for a little challenge.OH!and Lac Seul as much as I can,it's been 3 years since I've been up to Williams Bay.I can't believe my new boat will be 3 seasons old in 2014,time to start taking it down the rough dirt roads(it's not new any more)

Lake Vermilion, MN with my wife and our oldest daughter, son-in-law and 3 kids first week in June. Fisherman's Cove, Lac Seul with my wife 3rd week in August. Silver Water Wheel, Lac Seul with the guys the 3rd week in September. All with my new left knee. Bring it on. Lars
geez, you're lucky, I'd be happy to do any of the three or one of those trips next year.... probably targeting somewhere in Minnesota for MeSent from my HTC-PG762 using Tapatalk 2
Grassy narrows lotw first week in june cedar lake mid July last week in August obibikon and last of sept back to lotw around morson.
Lake of the Woods June 13. Out of Floating Lodges House Boat. We will be on the 60 footer.
Mike our group out of chicago planning last week of may 2014have bbc are you guys going next year maybe come during our week are the portage lakes any good? ? Jim wolf the chicago boys
Lake of the Woods; Houseboat out of TOMAHAWK RESORT; Late September.. a LOOOOOONNNNNGGGG time to go....
Jim, Our week is scheduled to be 8/2/14.We fished Flat Lake one day but the high sky and no wind had it shut down totally. Mike Kansas
Kenoji Lake with PFO 5/30-6/8, group of 8
Heading to Hilmer Lake, with Hearst air at the end of June!
I am going with 7 others to Brace Lake Outfitters June 15 through June 22. Looking forward to seeing Kyle and Teri at the Ultimate Fishing Show in Novi, MI in January.
Lac Seul last week in June and first week in August with my wife and grandson.
This will be my groups 11th yr. on Lac Herbert, last week of June, north camp #26. If you have never fished Hebert I suggest you put it on your bucket list.
lac des Mille lodge just west of Upsala, First week of June. (third week of the season)http://www.lacdesmille.com/index.htmlMay also go back up in July for a northern trip if enough want to go.
Pickeral Arm Camp, Lake Minnataki, 2nd week in June, 26th year.
Lac Seul at Gawley's Little Beaver Lodge.The last 2 weeks of July through the first 2 weeks of August.The hunt for big walleyes continues.Ice cold Kokanee will flow in the evenings.Bill

August 2nd. 2 Houseboats 12-13 guys Lac Seul somewhere near Taylor Island.. Can't wait to wake up and be on the SPOT wihin minutes!!! We upgraded the 1750Tyee to a 2025 Pro-V (2005) All new Lowarance Electronics 12" Touch Screen and HDS 9. -Minnkota Ipilot. Merc 235HP
Sounds like a great trip joeman. I have always wanted to try the houseboat gig. Didn't your group do this last year? if so how did it work for you? Thanks, Mike Kansas

Our mens group will be at Lac Seul Lodge (Black Bay Outpost) starting June 7. Taking the wife to Lost Island Lodge on Lac Seul the week of June 29. Also looking at Tobin Lake in October of next year. Expect large case of cabin fever to set in the next 30 days. Mike Kansas
No trip scheduled yet, waiting to hear back from a WC buddy for a trip to BBL on Red Lake.
The wife, daughter/son-in-law & myself are headed for Tall Pines on Wabaskang. We will be there the week of July 12-19. Can't hardly wait! It is going to be a longgg winter. Later, Jay
Red Wing Lodge on Lake of the Woods July 5-12, Goose Bay Camp on Lac Seul August 18-25.
Lake Hebert in Quebec with 3 pals. 45 minute flight out of Clova, QC. Air access only. Mid July. First time for us doing a fly-in. And from what I have read, not likely to be the last.
I'm invited on a fly in just North of Kenora in June., For the life of me I can't remember the lake. Hopefully my memory improves or somebody picks me up when it's time to go!!

I've booked two trips out of Lac Seul Lodge for 2014. Taking my wife and two boys the week of July 4. I also have their Sunlight outpost booked the first week in August. Not sure who all will be going on that one, but I know I'll be there. With any luck, I'll be able to squeeze in a third trip somewhere in Ontario - TBD.
Manotak Lodge both Memorial Day week and Labor Day week. 211 days and counting.
Sounds like I might meet Breezy Point next year, because we are booked at Red Wing Lodge july5-12 also. Back up there mid to late September also.
6 of us r heading to Melchett lake with AWO out of Nakina for opening weekend, I can't wait!! My only hope is that it's not gunna snow
